file_content.text: We can't thank you enough, Major.
Good luck to you, Major.
Major. Zess gave us the rundown on what happened down in maximum security.
It's not easy to think of Dagger Wing without Commander Gall in charge. Big shoes to fill.
You've got experience, Harlan. You'll do just fine.
I'm sure you're up to it.
We'll see.
With Ondorru in custody, Dagger Wing will get a fresh start.
At least we caught Ondorru.
Yeah, we'll finally have a clean reputation. I hope you really made him feel it.
If you weren't prepared for command, you shouldn't have taken the XO job.
You'd better learn fast.
Gall insisted--and when he asked you to do something, you didn't say no.
At least Dagger Wing's reputation can finally be cleared. I hope you knocked Ondorru around good.
The goal was to capture, not to torture.
Only necessary force.
That was one of the biggest scraps I've ever been in.
It was quite a fight.
I can't even imagine.
We needed Ondorru alive--unfortunately.
I would've liked to do worse.
Yeah. He better pay big for what he made us do to those poor people on Fest.
Hmph. Getting our reputations cleared is huge, but if I'd had the choice, I'd rather have Commander Gall alive.
Your commander wanted it this way, Harlan.
Gall made his choice.
It's up to you and Dagger Wing to honor that choice and make Gall proud.
I will. The Daggers will fight harder and fly better than ever before--we've got to make up for lost time.
You and your men have been through a lot, Harlan.
Do the best you can.
Just try to focus and stay sharp, and you'll make it through.
The war isn't going to be any kinder to us than Belsavis--we'll just grit our teeth and keep pushing.
If your pilots are going to survive this war, they need to fight at their best.
Get over it.
Those men are looking to you to pull them together, so make it happen!
You're right. Like it or not, I've got a wing of pilots to command. I'm not going to let them down.
SpecForce is lucky to have you, Major. If I can be half as good an officer as you or Commander Gall, I'll be doing good.
Thanks for all the help. I'll see you out in the field.
Better get a move on, Major.
I've been tracking a large contingent of Imperial personnel across the prison zones. I could use your help once we catch them.
The Imperials are heading straight for the maximum security area. If they release any of the prisoners there, it could be catastrophic.
I'll be glad to help you intercept the Imps, sir.
Understood.
What's so bad about the prisoners in the maximum security area?
Who is being held there?
That section of the prison was built by aliens older than the Republic itself. The creatures locked inside are a threat to the entire galaxy--they can't be set loose.
We'll stop the Imperials, sir. Don't worry.
They won't.
You're a prisoner here, how can you know so much?
How did you learn this?
Honestly, I wish I knew more. The guards told me what they could when we started working together.
Ancient aliens? Is this some kind of joke?
You've got to be kidding me.
Hard to believe, I know--and even I don't have all the details.
Intercepting Imperials isn't my goal here, Gall.
Not my problem.
But stopping the Empire is mine. If you want me, you're going to have to help.
You should know that several heavily armed commando teams broke off from the Imperials and took up positions throughout this sector.
The commandos are positioned to ambush any Republic reinforcements that cross the area. You should take them out if you can.
I'll hit the commandos on my way to the rendezvous.
Best to keep our lines clear.
I'm always up for hunting some Imps.
Sounds like fun.
Good--then I'll see you at the meeting coordinates. Gall out.
You're not my CO.
I don't have time to argue with you. Make any foolish choices you wish and meet me at the rendezvous coordinates. Gall out.
You heard the man, Major. Better get moving, or you might miss all of the fun.
Let's wrap this up fast.
Agreed.
If you want off this rock, think how anxious we are.
I want to know more about your commander.
Tell me about Gall.
He's the best there is. Wouldn't be Dagger Wing without Commander Gall.
After Fest, he held this unit together; made sure we all remembered who the real enemy is.
Bah, listen to me blabbing. You want to know about Gall, talk to him when you meet him. Good luck out there.
You pilots are more trouble than I bargained for.
Shut up.
We'll try to schedule the next Imperial invasion better.
Good luck out there.
That's what I'm telling you, Commander. They want us back on the double. They sent Havoc Squad, they're serious.
Hmm. How are the men taking it?
They're ready to get behind a stick again. But it doesn't sit right, sir, them just showing up and pulling us back in.
Commander Conrad Gall, I take it?
Sorry to interrupt.
Correct. You must be the major that Harlan's been talking about.
You're getting a second chance, Harlan. Most people don't.
This is a big opportunity.
Ah. Major. Welcome back to the party.
You signed up to serve, not to serve when you feel like it.
Orders are orders.
Great, the ground-pounder returns.
Ah. The charming Miss Major is back.
I'm Conrad Gall, Major. It's a pleasure.
I understand you've been busy saving my men from one deathtrap after another. I appreciate it.
I'm just trying to complete my mission, sir.
It was nothing.
Yes, your mission. I've heard.
This is easy work.
We can discuss your accomplishments later. Right now, let's address your mission.
I need you to get your pilots regrouped ASAP. We're leaving.
Make it up to me.
I'm afraid it's not that simple.
As Harlan has told you, I volunteered Dagger Wing to help the guards when the Imperial attack on Belsavis began. They accepted.
Dagger Wing always completes its missions. We aren't leaving until we've done our part.
Havoc Squad is on board, Gall. What's your plan?
Then neither will we.
I'll throw in with you, Gall. What needs to be done?
Then neither am I.
Nothing is ever easy.
The prison personnel are servants of the Republic, just like us. We're obligated to help them.
You're being offered your freedom! This place isn't your problem.
This is ridiculous!
The personnel here are part of the Republic, and they deserve our help. You can join in, or wait until I'm finished.
Good luck out there.
Look, maybe I was a little short with you. It's good to hear that Command wants us back, but they burned us pretty bad.
Even the good guys make mistakes sometimes. Have to roll with it and move on.
Yeah? You ever made a mistake that killed thousands of innocent people? It never would've happened if we'd known about those civilians.
I know how that goes. I guess I'm lucky they just demoted me for the mistake I didn't make.
I doubt you pulled anything as bad as Fest, pal. But we never would've done it if we'd known about those civilians.
Am I following this correctly? You feel that your punishment for murdering thousands of unarmed people was too severe?
We aren't murderers! We never would've made that bombing run if we'd known there were civilians down there!
We must show no hesitation or reservation in our war against the Empire, friend--our enemy certainly won't!
Nobody in Dagger Wing has a second thought about taking out Imps--but we had no idea the complex on Fest was full of civilians.
They're desperate for talent, pal. If you and your guys are any good at all, you can get a really sweet deal--believe me.
Believe me--we're the best in the galaxy. And we're not murderers. If we'd known about the civvies, we never would've launched.
When one has walked a path and found it treacherous, it is only wise to be wary when treading that path again.
Uh, sure. Look, I don't know what they told you, but we're not murderers. We had no idea we were bombing civilians out there.
I don't know what they told you about us, but we aren't murderers. We never would've launched if we'd known that complex was full of civilians.
What did you think you were bombing?
You had bad intel?
Murderers or not, my mission is to bring you back.
It doesn't matter either way.
Up until Fest, it was nothing but the mission for us, too.
You massacred thousands of civilians, whether you meant to or not.
Results outweigh intentions.
Yeah--what do you think that's like for us? That blood's on our hands.
Our target was a Sith Lord, Ondorru. A real sadistic bit of scum. He's razed dozens of Republic colonies and left no survivors.
Intel put Ondorru on Fest with nothing but soldiers and factories for company. We launched at full burn, dropped everything we had--and now we're here.
That must've been very hard on your unit.
I'm sorry for you.
If not for Commander Gall, the men would've gone rogue for sure. Ah--speaking of the men.
The guys upstairs are more worried about saving their images than saving the Republic.
Command is full of morons.
Don't get me started. Just gotta remember it's the Imps we're fighting, not the--ah, hold on.
No more talk, no more explanations. Take me to Gall.
You're wasting my time.
Fine, fine. We'll get these wounded men back to base, and then I'll start--whoa, hold on.
Harlan, sir--we've got a situation! Lin, Ty and Symo are trapped in one of the prison complexes--we can't get them out!
Great. Hang tight, Kal, we'll get you some backup on the double.
What do you say, Major? You need all of Dagger Wing, right? Care to go two-for-two on rescue ops today?
Havoc Squad doesn't leave anyone behind.
I'll be glad to help.
Glad to hear it!
Haven't failed a mission yet.
Whatever you say, ground-pounder.
You can meet up with Kal at these coordinates. I'll get these slackers back to base and catch up with you after. Good luck.
This is getting old.
If you don't want to pitch in, fine. But you'll be going back to your CO with a lot less pilots than you could've.
If you decide to start thinking straight, head for these coordinates and talk to my man Kal. I'm going to get my people back to base. Let's move!
Looks like we won this round. On your feet, people, get ready to move out.
Sounded like some serious fighting--you alright there, ground-pounder?
There was nothing I couldn't handle.
I'm fine.
No, I'd expect not.
Don't know what that was down there, but I killed them.
That was weird.
I don't even want to know.
I'm not here to chat. I'm here to find your CO.
Just take me to Gall.
Go get 'em!
Dagger Wing is still kicking, you murdering cowards!
Your backup is here, Harlan. And your medpacs.
Best news I've had all day. So did the army finally send reinforcements, or are--Havoc Squad!
It's our lucky day, ladies and gents. Dig in and patch yourselves up--the army has sent their best.
I want the Imperials' position, their armament--everything.
Give me a sitrep.
They're dug in farther into the tunnels, and they've got some serious heat--if we hadn't caught them by surprise, we'd all be dead.
There may be even worse things in here, too. I've heard there's scary stuff locked in these vaults--nobody opens them, ever.
Command wants you back on duty ASAP. Let the guards handle this.
Forget about the Imps.
What? They want us back in the service?
Does this mean we're flying again, sir? Back in the fight?
That's... no. No, Dagger Wing volunteered to help the guards defend Belsavis--we're not going anywhere until that mission is complete.
I'm here to put you murderers back on duty. We're leaving--now.
Move it, prisoners!
What did you just call us? Say it again. Say it one more time!
Take it easy, Tobin. Remember what Commander Gall told us. Besides, this is good news--they want us back!
Hmph. We'll see--after these Imps are dealt with. You hear me, ground-pounder? We told the guards we'd help them, and we're not leaving until that's done!
Point me at the Imps so I can clear them out.
Fine, then.
Deal.
You'd rather die on this backwater than get back in the cockpit?
Are you joking?
Dagger Wing always completes its missions. Always.
You're not even Dagger Wing's CO. Get Gall on the holo.
It's not your call.
You help us here, I'll get you Gall. That's a guarantee.
The Imps are dug in deeper in the tunnels. They're real pros--we're lucky we took 'em by surprise.
Stay sharp down there. I've heard scary rumors about the things locked in these vaults. Nobody opens them, ever.
I'll keep my eyes open for anything unusual.
Understood.
Zess said the same thing. Doesn't anyone have the whole story?
So I've heard.
No one in this zone. Somebody higher up probably knows the details, but they aren't likely to tell.
Can you tell me anything else about these vaults?
Is that all you know?
Not really. I heard they were already here when the Republic built the prison, and I believe it. They look old.
I'm not scared of rumors and superstitions.
That's nonsense.
Suit yourself. But don't say I didn't warn you.
We'll make sure nobody flanks you. Give those Imps what they deserve!
Imp scum! Come out here and fight!
